definitions.definition: used with I and we for talking about or predicting the future

examples.text: This time next week I shall be in Scotland.
I said that I should be pleased to help.

definitions.definition: used in questions with I and we for making offers or suggestions or asking advice
definitions.labels: North American EnglishBritish English(British English or formal, North American English)

examples.text: Shall I send you the book?
What shall we do this weekend?
Let's look at it again, shall we?

definitions.definition: used to show that you are determined, or to give an order or instruction

examples.text: He is determined that you shall succeed.
Candidates shall remain in their seats until all the papers have been collected.

wordOrigin: Old English sceal, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zal and German soll, from a base meaning ‘owe’.
